definition: to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from
to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲

sentences.english: Wally was now out of danger and removed from intensive care.
sentences.chinese: 沃利已经脱离危险，不再需要精心护理。

sentences.english: The patient is out of danger now, but it was touch and go for a while.
sentences.chinese: 病人现在已经脱离危险，但曾有一段时间吉凶未卜。

sentences.english: Thanks to the doctor, you are out of danger now.
sentences.chinese: 谢谢医生，我现在是脱离危险了。

sentences.english: I was able to use the knowledge I gained in Posen more than once to get out of dangerous situations.
sentences.chinese: 我不止一次利用我在波森学到的知识脱离危险。

sentences.english: Not until evening was our dog pronounced out of danger.
sentences.chinese: 到了傍晚，我们的狗才脱离危险。

sentences.english: The patient is out of danger.
The doctor is of opinion that your sister will be out of danger before long.
sentences.chinese: 医生认为你的姐姐不久会脱离危险。

sentences.english: Bruce and Jackson escaped from the peril in a whole skin.
sentences.chinese: 普鲁斯和杰克森平安地脱离危险。

sentences.english: Out tof debt, out of danger.
I was told at the hospital that my daughter was out of danger.
sentences.chinese: 我在医院得知我女儿已经脱离危险。

sentences.english: Then I can help many people out of danger.
sentences.chinese: 然后我能够帮忙很多人脱离危险。

sentences.english: The sick man's life had been in danger, but now he was out of danger.
sentences.chinese: 病人的生命曾处于危险之中，现在已脱离危险。

sentences.english: The patient was out of danger.

definition: to provide critical care (to a patient or a diseased plant)
to escape (danger)/to rescue/to come out alive
to send or deliver to the hospital
to leave hospital/to be discharged from hospital
to turn peril into safety (idiom); to avert a danger (esp. political or medical)
to lose consciousness/to be in a coma/stupor/coma/stunned/disoriented
in imminent peril (idiom)/on the brink of crisis
to transfer (a patient) to a different hospital/to transfer to hospital (e.g. a prisoner)
